description: Move some properties off the default export to individual named exports

Remove .keyword(), .hsl(), .hsv(), .hwb(), and .ansi() coloring methods
These were not commonly used and added a lot of bloat to Chalk.
The tagged template literal support moved into a separate package: chalk-template

This package is now pure ESM.
If you use TypeScript, you will want to stay on Chalk 4 until TypeScript 4.6 is out.
If you use a bundler, make sure it supports ESM and that you have correctly configured it for ESM.
The Chalk issue tracker is not a support channel for your favorite build/bundler tool.
It's totally fine to stay on Chalk v4. It's been stable for years.
